posts.com: What gives gold it’s value vs tungsten or something similar
posts.name: Anonymous

posts.com:
>>23859372
What gives anything value? Bitcoin is not easily replaceable because of the network effect.

People think bitcoin can be replaced like facebook replaced myspace. It doesn’t work like that the bitcoin network is enormous and decentralized. To build something like that from zero and invest to have the brand recognition bitcoin has would be insane.

Plus bitcoin is actually the best crypto because it is simple. Initially people thought it would be paypal 2.0 but no. It’s actually digital gold. It’s not a meme. And just like gold. Once it got going there’s no turning back until a better gold emerges.

Bitcoin has value because it is actually conceptually the best money ever invented that actually took off. At this point every day that goes by it becomes less and less likely bitcoin will disappear and more likely it will stay for the long term. IMHO bitcoin is already sucking up value like a black hole sucks matter. Once people get it and big money pours in it will pour faster and faster which will make it better and better.

Eventually bitcoin will be the worlds largest asset and will underpin the global economy ironically though it will probably be sorta separate from the economy kinda like the economy are planets revolving around the bitcoin sun.

This will allow for an explosion of economic diversity and innovation and tokenization. Currencies will be able to be created with purpose and function in mind like we never dreamed of before. All made possible by Bitcoin. By simply existing as a mathematical and automatic predictive and reliable store of value

posts.com:
>>23859372
The fact that game theoretically wise there is no point in switching to a new coin. You have a decade of intertia to overcome for zero gain, only loss. You need a cartel to overthrow Bitcoin 1.0 and Bitcoin 2.0 and without gubbermint cartels never form organically. At least never for very long.
So tl;dr common sense and game theoretics prevent a Bitcoin clone from reaching adoption.
All of the above is about Bitcoin SV of course, everything else in the "crypto markets" is false advertising at best and an incompetent fraud at worst.
